speaker: Bob
prompt: Bob is having a lunch meeting with his boss, Mr. James. Mr. James asks Bob: "Did you like the presentation that I gave at the board meeting yesterday?" Bob responds: "I cannot wait for our trip to Japan next week."
target: He disliked the talk that his boss gave but does not want to criticize his boss.
competitor: He is excited about the upcoming trip to Japan and does not want to talk about anything else.
distractor_1: He liked the talk that his boss gave but does not want to tell him about it.
distractor_2: He wants to avoid going to Japan next week and wants to discuss it with his boss.

speaker: Alex
prompt: Richard came to visit his friend, Alex. Alex is an artist. Richard brought one of his artworks to Alex and asked Alex: "What do you think of my painting?" Alex responds:"Have you noticed that I painted the walls?"
target: Alex thinks that Richard's painting is mediocre.
competitor: Alex is proud of the painting job that he did.
distractor_1: Alex wants Richards to help him paint the walls.
distractor_2: Alex is afraid that Richard will become a better painter than he is.

speaker: Jane
prompt: Leslie and Jane are chatting at a coffee shop. Leslie asks, "Who was that man that I saw you with last night?" Jane responds: "The latte is unbelievable here."
target: She does not want to discuss the topic that Leslie has raised.
competitor: She thinks that it is the best latte in the town.
distractor_1: The man who Leslie saw makes unbelievable lattes.
distractor_2: A coffee break is not a good time to discuss men.

speaker: Her husband
prompt: Kelsey is in a bad mood. Every minor thing irritates her. When she sees her husband watching a football game, she yells: "Can you turn off the TV?" Her husband replies:"Beer and chips would be awesome. Thanks!"
target: He pretends that he did not understand his wife's comment because he wants to watch the game.
competitor: He is thankful for her offer of beer and chips.
distractor_1: He is happy to turn off the TV right away and to spend more time with his wife.
distractor_2: He is excited about seeing his wife.

speaker: Mark
prompt: Mark is discussing Jane, a senior financial manager who he hired, with his colleague John. Mark asks: "How is Jane managing her new position?" Mark says:"She has excellent handwriting and is always dressed so nicely."
target: Mark's opinion of Jane as a financial manager is very low.
competitor: Mark is fond of people who have good handwriting.
distractor_1: Mark's opinion of Jane as a financial manager is very high.
distractor_2: Mark needs to get some new clothes.

speaker: Her mom
prompt: Lucy discusses her trip to Paris with her mom. Lucy says: "I'd like to visit Vincent when I am in Paris. Where does he live?" Her mom responds:"Somewhere in France."
target: Lucy's mom does not know where exactly Vincent lives.
competitor: Lucy's mom knows that Vincent lives somewhere in France.
distractor_1: Lucy's mom is afraid that Lucy will go to France.
distractor_2: Lucy's mom is jealous that she is not going to Paris.

speaker: Melanie
prompt: Luke missed a wedding reception and wants his wife Melanie to tell him about it. He asks: "What were you served at the wedding?" She responds:"Some food."
target: The food at the wedding was mediocre.
competitor: There was not a lot of food at the wedding.
distractor_1: The food at the wedding was outstanding.
distractor_2: The wedding is not about food.

speaker: Mary
prompt: Mary and Ken are having breakfast. Ken asks Mary: "How would you like your tea, dear?" Mary responds:"In a cup."
competitor: Mary wants Ken to serve her tea in a cup.
distractor_1: Mary wants Ken to wash a cup that she sees in the sink.
distractor_2: Mary is proud of the new cups that she got from Ken for her birthday.

speaker: Cindy
prompt: George and Cindy are about to enter their favorite shoe shop in the mall. George asks Cindy: "What would you like to buy?" Cindy responds:"A pair of shoes."
target: Cindy does not know what type of shoes she wants to buy.
competitor: Cindy is excited about going shopping.
distractor_1: Cindy does not plan to buy anything but shoes in this store.
distractor_2: Cindy has an obsession with shoes and buys them on every occasion.

speaker: Mike
prompt: Mike comes home from school. His mom asks him: "What did you do at school today?" Mike responds:"Some schoolwork."
target: He does not want to talk about school with his mom.
competitor: He has been doing lots of schoolwork at school.
distractor_1: He is upset that his dad is not at home.
distractor_2: He is too excited to talk about this at the moment.

speaker: Mark
prompt: Mark, who is a newlywed, is talking to his mom over the phone. His mom asks: "Did Julie cook your dinner last night?" Mark responds:"Well, she placed a number of edible substances into a pot and then heated them until various chemical reactions took place."
target: Mark's wife has little experience with cooking.
competitor: Mark's wife has been doing some scientific experiments instead of cooking.
distractor_1: Mark's wife has a lot of experience with cooking.
distractor_2: Mark's wife has been angry with Mark because he did not help her with dinner.

speaker: Marcie
prompt: Lenny comes to the kitchen and asks his wife, Marcie: "What will we have for breakfast?" Marcie responds:"A hard-boiled egg cooked in hot water and toast that is toasted evenly on both sides."
target: Marcie thinks that her husband's expectations about breakfast are too high.
competitor: Marcie wants Lenny to know how his breakfast was made.
distractor_1: Marcie is really good at cooking eggs and making toast.
distractor_2: Marcie thinks that breakfast is the main meal of the day.

speaker: Melissa
prompt: Mike and Melissa are arguing about the state of secondary education in their state. Mike states: "Standardized test scores are up 42% in our schools." Melissa responds:"And 47% of the kids didn't use the right pencil, 6% were chewing gum during the exam, and 32% yawned while completing their exams."
target: Melissa thinks that statistical information is useless in this debate.
competitor: Melissa thinks that statistical information is of great use in this debate.
distractor_1: Melissa is very knowledgeable about the system of secondary education.
distractor_2: Melissa thinks that kids attending schools lack subject knowledge.

speaker: Dan
prompt: Rosy notes to her friend Dan: "Those strangers at the other end of the subway car are nice." Dan replies:"Yeah, I bet they have only sweet dreams, eat organic food, do yoga every morning, plant trees, feed homeless, and read a lot of good books."
target: He thinks that Rosy has no reason to believe that the strangers are nice.
competitor: He thinks that people who ride subways have many good habits.
distractor_1: He thinks that people who ride subways have many bad habits.
distractor_2: He knows these people and their lifestyle very well.

speaker: Freddie
prompt: Berta often forgets to return money that she borrows from her friends. One day Berta asks her friend Freddie for $500. Freddie responds:"Of course, but only when I fly to space."
target: Freddie will never give Berta any money.
competitor: Freddie can give Berta some money that he will get for his space expedition.
distractor_1: Freddie is ready to give money to Berta without any questions.
distractor_2: Freddie considers giving the money to Berta.

speaker: Katy
prompt: Lars and Katy are discussing their CEO. Lars says: "People regard our CEO Mr. Smith as a real intellectual." Katy responds:"Sure, he is regarded as an intellectual by kindergarteners."
target: Katy doubts that Mr. Smith is a smart individual.
competitor: Katy agrees that Mr. Smith is a smart individual.
distractor_1: Katy thinks that Mr. Smith works at a kindergarten.
distractor_2: Katy knows that Mr. Smith's kids are kindergarteners.

speaker: Samanthaâ€™s dad
prompt: Samantha is talking with her dad about her fiance. Samantha notes: "John is an innocent person." Her dad replies:"Undoubtedly, as innocent as a saint."
target: Samantha's dad thinks that Samantha has an incorrect view of her fiance.
competitor: Samantha's dad thinks that Samantha's fiance is a saint.
distractor_1: Samantha's dad is impressed with John's innocence.
distractor_2: Samantha's dad thinks that John is too religious.

speaker: Bianka
prompt: Lenny is saying goodbye to his date Bianka. Lenny asks Bianka: "Where do you live?" Bianka responds:"I live on the moon."
target: Bianka does not want Lenny to know her address.
distractor_1: Bianka is not very well educated.
distractor_2: Bianka tries to make Lenny angry with her.

speaker: Kelly
prompt: Annie and Kelly are discussing their plans for summer. Annie asks Kelly: "How many books do you plan to read this summer?" Kelly responds:"A million."
target: Kelly plans to devote a lot of time to reading this summer.
competitor: Kelly has made a list of books to read that contains one million titles.
